blogPost.title: Forced To Say Goodbye? Try These
blogPost.content:
Industry reports across the spectrum have been talking about increasing attrition in various industries and sectors. And it is a growing concern for HR since workplaces and work itself are seeing a significant change over the last year. 

 

However, there are times when the organization has to take a tough decision and ask an employee to leave. Reasons may vary; it could be that the company needs to reform and the existing employee doesn't fit in the scheme of things, or they may have been unproductive. Whatever it is, one thing is common in all these situations - heartbreak, hopelessness & low confidence.

 

So, what is it that HR can try to do before asking an employee to leave?

 

- Find the root of the problem. Try to infer the reasons for the employee's deteriorating performance and work towards it. It could be that there is a strain in the employee-manager relationship that is decreasing the formers' productivity. In this case, a communication channel needs to be established to understand and forge the differences.

 

- Speak to the employee to understand their aspiration and match them to organizational goals. It could be possible that the employee may be good in another field that they may never have paid heed to. 

 

- In the case mentioned above, HR could speak to leaders and the employees' immediate manager to try and find an alternative, if possible. Thus the employee could be moved to another project or team.

 

- Put a 30-to-60 days plan in place where the employee can be coached and corrected.

 

- Access the employee's records to check where the employees' passion lies. Thereafter, HR can initiate a mentorship program to upskill the employee.

 

- Reset Work Expectations And Create A Plan Together. It could be that the employee needs a level-setting. In that case, it is essential for HR to reset the expectations and put together a plan for their success.
